question_stem: Suppose that the following simple linear regression model has been fitted to the Taiwan real estate data from topic 05. The model is Y = β₀ + β₁ ln(X₁) + e, where X₁ corresponds to distance to the nearest MRT. The following output was obtained from Python. What is the estimated mean for a new observation with distance to MRT 1.5 km? Show all the Python code used.
question_stem_html:
Suppose that the following simple linear regression model has been fitted to the Taiwan real estate data from topic 05:

Y=β0+β1ln(X1)+eY = \beta_0 + \beta_1 \ln(X_1) + e

where X₁ corresponds to distance to the nearest MRT. The following output was obtained from Python:

What is the estimated mean for a new observation with distance to MRT 1.5 km? Show all the Python code used.

question_media.alt: OLS Regression Results table from Python output.

items.code_snippet:
new_df = sm.add_constant(pd.DataFrame({'dist_MRT': 1500.0}, index=[0]))
new_df['ldist'] = np.log(new_df.dist_MRT)

print(f"The estimated mean is {predictions_out.predicted_mean[0]:.3f}")
items.solution_html:
The estimated mean is 29.757.

new_df = sm.add_constant(pd.DataFrame({'dist_MRT': 1500.0}, index=[0]))
new_df['ldist'] = np.log(new_df.dist_MRT)

print(f'The estimated mean is {predictions_out.predicted_mean[0]:.3f}')
